isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built After June 2, 2002 - clean and inspect - ROTOR AND WHEEL HUB ASSEMBLY

warning.para: If you use cleaning solvents, hot solution tanks or alkaline solutions incorrectly, serious personal injury can occur. To prevent injury, follow the instructions supplied by the manufacturer. Do not use gasoline to clean parts. Gasoline can explode.

step1.para:
Clean rotor and wheel hub (Items 12 and 8, Figure 30)

for rear with solvent. Use compressed air to dry and clean out clogged or restricted rotor vent holes. If rotor vent holes are not clean, use a screwdriver to dislodge any foreign material and blow out with compressed air.

note.para: When using compressed air, use air lines that are completely free of oil and moisture.

step1.para: Visually inspect rotor machined surfaces that are in contact with disc brake pads, for grease, brake fluid leakage, scoring, warping, cracks, bluing, heat spots or other damage or defects. If grease, brake fluid leakage, damage or defects are found, repair or replace as required. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the Master Service Manual for specifications on inspecting and reconditioning of rotors.
